cn3xxx_oq_config_t Struct Reference

#include <octeon_config.h>

Detailed Description

Structure to define configuration attributes for each Output queue in the CN38XX/CN58XX Octeon processors.

Definition at line 105 of file octeon_config.h.

Data Fields

uint32_t num_descs
 Size of Output queue (number of descriptors).
uint32_t buf_size
 Size of buffer in this Output queue.
uint32_t info_ptr
 If set, the Output queue uses info-pointer mode.
uint32_t pkts_per_intr
 Number of packets to be processed by driver tasklet every invocation for this Output queue.
uint32_t intr_pkt
 Interrupt Coalescing (Packet Count).
uint32_t intr_time
 Interrupt Coalescing (Time Interval).
uint32_t refill_threshold
 The number of buffers that were consumed during packet processing by the driver on this Output queue before the driver attempts to replenish the descriptor ring with new buffers.

uint32_t cn3xxx_oq_config_t::info_ptr

If set, the Output queue uses info-pointer mode.

(Default: 1 )

Definition at line 114 of file octeon_config.h.

uint32_t cn3xxx_oq_config_t::intr_pkt

Interrupt Coalescing (Packet Count).

Octeon will interrupt the host only if it sent as many packets as specified by this field. The driver usually does not use packet count interrupt coalescing.

Definition at line 123 of file octeon_config.h.

uint32_t cn3xxx_oq_config_t::intr_time

Interrupt Coalescing (Time Interval).

Octeon will interrupt the host if atleast one packet was sent in the time interval specified by this field. The driver uses time interval interrupt coalescing by default. The time is specified in microseconds.

Definition at line 129 of file octeon_config.h.

uint32_t cn3xxx_oq_config_t::pkts_per_intr

Number of packets to be processed by driver tasklet every invocation for this Output queue.

Definition at line 118 of file octeon_config.h.

uint32_t cn3xxx_oq_config_t::refill_threshold

The number of buffers that were consumed during packet processing by the driver on this Output queue before the driver attempts to replenish the descriptor ring with new buffers.
